# Connecting to Smartphones (USB)

## Micro-B
Use a USB on-the-go (OTG) cable.

!USB OTG Cable Diagram

- **Type-C connector (male)**
- **Type-A connector (male)**
- **Micro-B connector (male)**
- **Type-A connector (female)**

> ğŸ’¡ **Note:**
> - The smartphone must support USB OTG.
> - The desired results cannot be achieved with a USB Type-C-to-Micro-B cable. Use an OTG cable.

### Steps to Connect:

1. **Select either AUTO or POWER SUPPLY OFF/COMM ON** for USB POWER SUPPLY/COMM SETTING in the network/USB setting menu.

2. **Select USB CARD READER for CONNECTION MODE.**

3. **Connect the camera and smartphone using a USB cable.**
   - If the smartphone asks for permission for an app other than the "Camera Importer" to access the camera, tap â€œCancelâ€ and move on to the next step.

4. **On your smartphone, tap the notification â€œConnected to USB PTPâ€.**

5. **From the recommended apps, select â€œCamera Importerâ€.**
   - The app will automatically start and allow you to import photos and movies to your smartphone.

> ğŸ’¡ **Note:**
> - If the message â€œThere is no MTP device connectedâ€ appears on the app, please try again from step 3.
